alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Aroostook County through 430 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deboullie Mountain, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Eagle Lake, Deboullie Mountain, New Canada, Cross Lake, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint John, Soldier Pond and Saint Francis. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Winterville and Wallagrass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
